p: Data were entered in two Microsoft Access databases (Microsoft Corp, Va., USA) for patientâ€™s data and laboratory findings and linked by the single identification number. Statistical analyses were performed using StataIC 13.1 (Statacorp, College Station, TX). Chi-squared tests were used to compare proportions and categorical variables among groups. Values of p<0.05 were considered significant. Bivariate analysis was performed on all symptoms and syndromes recorded against laboratory findings; symptoms and/or syndromes with a p-value below 0.2 were assessed in a logistic regression and symptoms and/or symptoms with significant OR were retained.
